org.guicebox
Class GuiceBox

java.lang.Object
  org.guicebox.GuiceBox
All Implemented Interfaces:
GuiceBoxMBean
public final class GuiceBox
extends java.lang.Object
implements GuiceBoxMBean

Entry point to GuiceBox. Takes a Guice Injector and searches its bindings for classes annotated with Start, Stop and Kill annotations. The lifecycle of the application is then controlled via these annotated members. See GuiceBox documentation for details.

Author:
willhains

Method Summary
 void kill()
          Kills the application by calling all the methods annotated with Kill, and shutting down GuiceBox.
 void registerJMX()
          Registers GuiceBox with JMX.
 void start()
          Starts the application by calling all the methods annotated with Start, and starting threads for all Runnables annotated with Start.
 void stop()
          Stops the application by calling all the methods annotated with Stop, and interrupting all threads started during start().
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Method Detail

start

public void start()
Starts the application by calling all the methods annotated with Start, and starting threads for all Runnables annotated with Start.

This method is non-blocking. It will return immediately. The @Start methods/threads will be started asynchronously.

Specified by:
start in interface GuiceBoxMBean

stop

public void stop()
Stops the application by calling all the methods annotated with Stop, and interrupting all threads started during start().

This method is non-blocking. It will return immediately.

Specified by:
stop in interface GuiceBoxMBean

kill

public void kill()
Kills the application by calling all the methods annotated with Kill, and shutting down GuiceBox.

This method is non-blocking. It will return immediately.

Specified by:
kill in interface GuiceBoxMBean

registerJMX

public void registerJMX()
                 throws javax.management.JMException
Registers GuiceBox with JMX. See JMX Documentation for details on how to secure access.

Throws:
javax.management.JMException - if the MBean couldn't be registered for some reason.
See Also:
ObjectName.ObjectName(String), MBeanServer.unregisterMBean(ObjectName), MBeanServer.registerMBean(Object, ObjectName)
